result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody Joseph Britz

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

2:47 PM  Defendant Cody Joseph Britz in court.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 1 and 2.  Court finds defendant guilty. 
Count 3 is dismissed by operation of law. 

Court orders the following:

COUNT 1:  
60 DAYS in the Waukesha County jail w/Huber (all standard release conditions).  Defendant to report to the Huber facility by 5 pm. on 11/07/2022. -  CONCURRENT WITH COUNT 2;
 
D/L REVOCATION: 16 months;
IGNITION INTERLOCK: 16 months;

FINE: $1355 -  includes IID surcharge: 

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200;
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $36.05 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to Waukesha Police Department or to be converted to a civil judgment for non payment of fee.

To be paid at the rate of $75 per month, starting 1/1/2023 and the 1st of every month until paid in full.  Penalty:  Entry of a Civil Judgment


Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH.

**********

COUNT 2:  

60 DAYS n the Waukesha County jail w/Huber (all standard release conditions).  Defendant to report to the Huber facility by 5 pm. on 11/07/2022. -  CONCURRENT WITH COUNT 1;

Costs:  $243.

DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200.

To be paid at the rate of $75 per month consecutive to count 1; until paid in full.  Penalty:  Entry of a Civil Judgment

Court orders forfeiture and destruction of the firearm as listed in the complaint.

10:59 AM
Case not called on the Record.
Attorney Kristi Gordon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant Cody Joseph Britz appeared by video.  
Defendant requests a plea/sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Case called at 8:53 AM 
District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Cody Joseph Britz in court.  
State filed an Amended Complaint on 7-27-2022.
Defendant enters a plea of not guilty to Count 3.
Defendant indicates that he is working on retaining an attorney.  Hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Laboratory report filed by the State.

8:29 AM   File not called on the record.
District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Cody Joseph Britz in court by zoom.
All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.
Defendant indicates that he needs a little more time to retain his attorney.  Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.

8:31 AM   File not called on the record.
Alyssa M Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Cody Joseph Britz in court.  
Defendant to contact the Public Defender's Office.
Defendant was given paperwork so if he doesn't qualify, he is to fill out the Court appointed attorney paperwork.  Hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant is not to go armed during the pendenancy of this action.  Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.

02:18 PM Defendant Cody Joseph Britz in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
